dialogues.text: I have come to remind you that the  winged party boys are just that:  spoiled boys. You are armed, however  pathetically, with the one thing  they never really understood:  theology. It's not much, but that's  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this supposed to be our "win one  for The Ripper" speech?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't press your luck, Mr. Daggett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know instantly, in the bottom of your stomach, th those eyes mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go and get ready, Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas hesitates, holds the gaze, then turns and leaves. an instant Lucifer sweeps down from the hogan roof to  Katherine's side. Face and eyes and maggot breath  uncomfortably close, he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever considered Katherine,  that the great absentee landlord,  the soft-eyed eagle scout your  childhood prayers are for, is just  using you? That you're only the  exterminator to get rid of his pests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer places a cloaked arm around her shoulder and lead her to the walled edge to look out across the endless pla His mouth presses against her ear and whispers,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's junkies are coming, Katherine.  And when they do, all hell is going  to break loose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny speck on the empty horizon. It grows, takes shape, and finally becomes a red convertible rambler as it WOOSH past on a desolate throat of forgotten highway. Gabriel's at the wheel. Beside him, grey-blonde hair stre out behind her, is Rachael, recently lifted from the file and-forget section of the hospital ICU. She tilts her hea up. Lets the sun warm her pallor. Just a sociopathic ange and his somewhat deceased babe out for a top-down cruise  across a sixty million year old desert. It could happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reality bruised waitress, Madge, sets down a coffee and milkshake before Gabriel. He downs the shake in one belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Ma'am, any idea where I can  find Old Woman Butte?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you could be just a  tad more specific. Madge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress' eyes move from the guy with sunglasses and  burn marks on his shirt to the woman sitting alone outsid in the rambler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't your friend hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a while, I'm afraid. Funniest  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madge has a lot of things she misses in her life, but one them she decides isn't Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take 522 to the Sonsela Wash cut- off. First dirt road go left. Twenty,  twenty-five miles you'll see it.  Big, black and all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel downs the coffee, stands, and tosses a bill on th counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt we'll meet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suits me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas drags a heavy chain from Katherine's truck and beg fastening it to a post. Lucifer watches perched on a near rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could always lend a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer just smiles or sneers or whatever he does with th hideous mouth.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE KIVA
dialogues.text: Grey Horse begins laying out his prayer instruments as Ma is prepared with paint and oils.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Katherine leans against the doorway, nervously watching t horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky thinning into uneasy pastels as the sun falls  unceremoniously toward the mountains. A few lanterns have been lit, and from inside the kiva can be heard the chant of the Navaho Enemy Ghost Way. Katherine's eyes are still on a horizon dropping off into shadow. She stiffens. There, at the end of the earth, app a silent plume of dust. It could be anybody's car, but it can only be one car. Thomas steps up beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas sticks his head into the kiva, speaks softly to on of the elderly villagers attending the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any way to speed this up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire has been built on the kiva's floor. Through the ch smoke can be seen Mary lying on a mat as Grey Horse chant to the yei spirits and adds fine colored earth to the gro sand painting beside her. His voice rises and falls in  guttural syntax. He's coaxing. Coaxing the alien spirit o of the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls his head out and hands Katherine the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay inside. It's only one round, so  make it count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pause and for a moment their eyes lock. She tou his arm, almost says something, then disappears into the  kiva. Thomas closes the door behind her. He turns and loo out at the distant plume of dust. Growing closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio turned up, sophomoric grin glued on his face, Gabri roars past and begins the snaking climb up the side of th butte. The sun has almost completely slipped away now, le the land a deathly bluish grey. The road flattens out at the top of the butte and Gabriel can see the village glowing at the far end. He punches th rambler, winding it up for the last stretch, and pats the blonde on the knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll like this, Rachael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. There's a sudden glint of metal in the headlights as Thom at the last moment PULLS UP the heavy chain and HOOKS it  over the far post. Gabriel does something pointless with brakes and SLAMS forward into it. The whole rear of the c STANDS UP on impact, PITCHING Gabriel through the windshi into the dust. Thomas steps out from behind the post armed with an iron  bar. The rambler hisses and belches a death rattle as he  cautiously walks toward the spot of gloom where Gabriel l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Nice move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas's feet crunch softly closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to come work for us.  Upstairs. We sneak the odd civilian  in now and then, you know. You'd  like it. Nobody tells you when to go  to bed, can eat all the ice cream  you want. And you get to kill. All  day and all night. Just like an angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas doesn't answer. Gabriel's body looks ravaged as he carefully steps closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save yourself, friend. Why go to the  wall with the bitch and her rug rat?  It'll all turn out the same anyway.  Here or in heaven, we're still gonna  tear the kid apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an angel, heaven or hell.  I'm a man you eyeless puke, which  means I have one thing you never  will. A soul. And though I may,  somewhere inside, believe in a God,  I will never, never, believe in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little speechy today, aren't we? (sighs) Okay pal, have it your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's legs suddenly SWING AROUND and SMACK Thomas,  sprawling him back into the dirt. The iron bar goes flyin as Gabriel in a flash is on top of him. Thomas thrashes b Gabriel easily pins his shoulders and sits on his chest.  Without hurry he uncurls the fingers of his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to really, really hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas's eyes are wild with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You -- your war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's spread fingers lower themselves toward his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, son, out with it. Make this  one count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your war's a lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running around acting like this is  really about whether Christ is just  the son of God or if he is God.  Bullshit! That's not what this is  about at all, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then prove it to me, Gabriel. I  studied three fucking years of  theology before I picked up a gun.  C'mon, you're chief goddamn angel,  I'm just a little man. Prove to me  Christ is just a son and less than  God. Prove it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you can't! Because this war  isn't about some obscure medieval  hangup. You're just jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me, Gabriel. Go on. Prove to me  the temporal nature of the Trinity.  Show me through logic how the Son of  the Word can be separated from the  Father. Fight me with philosophy,  Gabriel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you and your army are wrong!  And you know it. You knew it sixteen  centuries ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to listen to him! He's  just a son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. You're jealous. Jealous  He could love something more than  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses) Shut up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's becoming unglued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wanted to know so badly,  Gabriel, why didn't you just ask  Him? Why didn't you just ask God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shudder passes through Gabriel. He straightens up and l down at Thomas as emotion racks his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because He doesn't talk to us anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two stare at one another. Then Gabriel, lost in himse suddenly turns away from Thomas and walks into the darkne For the village. Thomas climbs quickly to his feet, spins around -- -- And is HIT full-force by a rabid, SHRIEKING Rachael. H legs lock around his body vise-like as her teeth and nail DIG into his skin. He cries out and stumbles to the groun The two grapple furiously in the dust, Rachel's crazed fa taking BITE after BITE out of his shoulder and neck. Thomas manages a fistfull of her hair and YANKS the fangs off his shoulder. With his other arm he CUFFS her hard,  BREAKING the grip and ROLLING her aside. He staggers to h knees and begins to run. Shrieking, a mad porcelain bansh out of the dusk, Rachael catches up and TACKLES him. On t way down his head strikes a small stone wall and the pain white thunder. Gagging and weeping in blank shock, he cra on his hands and knees as Rachael OPENS UP his arm from  shoulder to elbow with her nails. As the blood tumbles li ribbons, Rachael JUMPS onto his back, DIGGING her claws i his scalp. It's about all one human can take. Mad with pain and anger and desperation, Thomas manages t climb to a shaky crouch, Rachael still shrieking on his b Throwing all his weight backward, he JAMS her into the sh stone wall. The impact SNAPS her hold and PROPELS her ove the wall -- And two thousand feet down the side of the butte. Thomas Daggett can only curl up into a ball, gulping shal shuddering breaths.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Gabriel walks resolutely up to the first hogan and KICKS  down the plank wood door. No one home. He walks to the se and KICKS its door down. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KIVA
dialogues.text: Mary's ceremony is nearing a crescendo. Grey Horse has do the colorful mask of the yei god Monster Slayer as the  relatives now join in the guttural chants of the Enemy Gh Way. Through the thick, choking smoke of the ceremonial f we see Katherine, nervously watching the door.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DARKNESS OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Thomas tries hopelessly to make his way back. Stumbling e few steps, he's beyond pain and into driven numbness. It' hopeless though. We know it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Gabriel KICKS down another door to another empty hogan.  There's only one left. As he approaches, from within can heard the muffled sound of chanting.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Takes a few more fumbling steps and falls again. He reach out to something metal for support. It's Katherine's pick

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Steps up to the kiva door and KICKS it. The frame buckles but holds. He steps back a few feet, puts all his weight  into a turn, and KICKS again. The door SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Wood splinters ROCKET through the smoke as Gabriel appear in the doorway. Grey Horse, everyone, freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax folks, it's just a soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the smoke steps Katherine. She FIRES, one rou into Gabriel's side. The archangel is pitched against the kiva's wall, where he stays a moment before turning to  Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting real tired of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands her ground between him and the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven, darling. Heaven. At least  get the zip code right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all the same, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. In heaven we believe in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you love, Gabriel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, the shade of doubt holds him up. But it's qui pushed aside for a corrupted grin. He's given up all pret

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Cracking your skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He advances on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all it is for you anymore,  Gabriel, isn't it? Just the killing  and the burning. You don't work for  God anymore. You don't fight for  love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's on her. With his left arm he brutally forces her her knees as his right hand, palm out and fingers splayed clamp themselves over her face. Katherine's mouth opens i silent scream as the pain, immediate and beyond endurance flows through her body. From somewhere outside, there's a sound. Katherine gulps chokes of agony as her very clothes begin smolder around her. We hear the sound once more, closer, before -- The entire kiva wall EXPLODES INWARD as Katherine's picku CRASHES through it. The mangled grill and hood SLAM into  Gabriel from the side and SMASH him to the ground like a  broken puppet. Katherine falls backward to the floor, get up, and runs to the truck's cab. Inside sits a near catat Thomas. Katherine takes only a second to share a look wit him before reaching back and pulling out the pickup's tir iron. Gabriel, a shattered, broken thing, pulls himself up to h knees. The sunglasses are gone and two eyeless pits stare out at Mary, huddled in the corner. Bleeding from every p one arm bent back the wrong way, he crawls across the flo toward her, his voice the milky slur of a stroke victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God loves you, Mary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine brings the tire iron down on his skull with all her might, DRIVING him to the floor. She turns to Grey Ho her eyes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, everyone, just stare. Stunned to stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey Horse timidly picks up his prayer stick and with a v faltering and cracked, in the insane glare of the wrecked pickup's headlights, resumes the Enemy Ghost Way chant. Katherine turns back to Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HITS him again with the tire iron. Then lifts it high once more above her head. She's going to crush him, to im his skull. When a hand stops her. Sort of a hand. A claw. Lucifer's. He's standing behind h holding the raised bar still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine releases the bar and lets it clang to the floor Lucifer turns to the villagers, gazing fearfully at him a they awkwardly try to finish the chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer's gaze falls on a deeply fucked-up Gabriel who gr at the sight of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, this just isn't my day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer kneels down beside him. Katherine instinctively s to reach for the tire iron but the sycophant hisses a liq chattering warning at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world's young, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And full of ambition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I remember the last one. Michael's  war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But lots of angels were with me.  every one followed their leader out  of heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah, I was there, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except one. Oh, he was with me all  right. He hated the Eagle Scout.  Envied the power He gave to His Son.  But this angel never came out front  during the war. And when it ended he  thought maybe, maybe the Eagle Scout  didn't notice. So he laid low and  towed the company line till he could  start his own war. It was all just  jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But maybe He did notice. Maybe that's  why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Stay away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've always been a part of me,  Gabriel. And now it's time to come  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer slams Gabriel's head against the floor and pins i As the angel thrashes furiously, Lucifer FORCES his arm i Gabriel's chest. Gabriel cries out as Lucifer PULLS his a half out and FORCES it deeper. Again. And again. Soon  Gabriel's screams become giggles, then a crazed, hysteric laughter. The room goes insane. An impossible nightmare of chanting Navahos, glaring headlights, and Gabriel's echoing laught as Lucifer pumps his chest. Laughter that rises to a kind orgasmic cry then instantly stops as Lucifer pulls out th angel's heart, And eats it. At that instant Grey Horse places his hand on Mary's fore speaks a last line, and the chant is completed. Sticky, smoky, awful silence. Gabriel is a non-thing. A  battered, hollow shell. Bartholomew Grey Horse, his voice cracked and finished, t to Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enemy spirit is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak, faint) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside the kiva suddenly comes the sound of a wound savage GROWL. Katherine walks to the doorway. Just outsid lone coyote is twisting in the dirt with furious agony.  Abruptly its thrashings cease. The animal stands and flas for an instant at Katherine cold yellow eyes more than an Then it's gone into the blackness. Forever. She turns and goes back to Thomas in the cab. Bleeding to death is a real possibility for him. She pulls an old shi out of the back and tries to makeshift a wrap for his sli arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More will come... To look for the  soul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they won't find it. Not in Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the village elders appear at the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have some bandages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine walks over to where Mary, sweaty and shaken, si huddled in a corner attended by Grey Horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, pumpkin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary's voice shakes as tears roll out her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine gathers her up into her arms and holds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be okay... We're all  going to be okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chattering, hissing sycophant grabs Gabriel's body by the hair and shoulders and drags it out the door. Lucifer has remained behind, crouched on his haunches, his liquid yellow eyes on Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't quite bring myself to say  thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then this is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. Maybe I like you.  Maybe I want you to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises to his feet and steps slowly toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me, Katherine. And you're  going to ask me to take you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching Mary) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. You will because any other  way is going to be more awful than  you can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a grinning, twisted stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you've picked the wrong person  this time. I've just about had it up  to here with ghosts. So you can put  away the horror movie sneer and the  K-Mart halloween eyes, because we  know you now. We know you all. And  if you want to force the issue then  go ahead because you're just another  angel to me. Take a look at your  buddy Gabriel. Then ask yourself, do  you really, really want to fuck with  us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smallest hint of a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps another time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holding my breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Katherine. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's gone. Through the door and into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, honey... I don't  think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fullness of day over Old Woman Butte, hot and bright. Chasing the night and its fears away under the punishing  glare of noon. The village is full of police vehicles now. Green broncos from the Navaho Tribal Police. Blue and white sheriff  department sedans. The Navaho cops are talking with Katherine and Mary. Thom is sitting on the trunk of a patrol car getting his wound properly bandaged as the Sheriff we met earlier leans bes him chewing on a wild oat stalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to deputy bandaging  Thomas) Is he going to live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With any luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thomas) I thought I told you to give me a  call if anything snarled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There wasn't a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chews some more on his stalk. Looks off at the village

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fella, Gabriel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty violent guy, Gabriel. Even  for out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught up with him at the village?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He caught up with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing way up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enemy Ghost Way for Mary Tsosie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indian stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Indian stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff looks over at Katherine's pickup still jammed into the side of the kiva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill this Gabriel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have any idea where the body  is I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if he's alive he won't get far  out there. Us or the coyotes, it'll  be the same. (beat) I rang your office in LA. They don't  have a warrant out for a Gabriel. Or  anybody else in Arizona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hadn't gotten around to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of an out of pocket thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff takes his hat off. Runs his finger along the  inside band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman lying at the bottom of  the arroyo, the one still in her  hospital gown, know anything about  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Gabriel was sure one busy dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be going back to Los Angeles  now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff pushes off from the patrol car and tosses asi the oak stalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurry back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputy finishes his bandaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do much but breathe the next  few days. And get to a hospital.  You're going to need some serious  stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hi to Hollywood for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows his boss. Katherine and Mary walk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I feel worse. (to Katherine re Navaho  cops) They lean on you much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I think they might have  even understood. One of them's related  to this clan. He'll give us a ride  back if we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I think I've about run out of  hospitality with the sheriff's  department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment drifts into silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's really over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till we die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes settle on his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I die, I want you with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his cheek, Mary cradled between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas sitting in the back of the tribal police bronco,  looking out the window to the shimmering sands; red and y and black. To clouds brewing over faraway forgotten mount To the end of the earth. As the bronco drifts away from us toward the empty, rocky horizon, as it slowly blends and is consumed by the land,
